alert.note: Alert for Walsh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 10:17PM CDT until May 18 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. Maple River near Enderlin affecting Ransom and Cass Counties. Pembina River at Walhalla affecting Pembina and Cavalier Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Roseau River at Roseau affecting Roseau County. Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Norman and Traill Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Marshall, Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. Sheyenne River at Lisbon affecting Ransom County. Sheyenne River near Kindred affecting Richland and Cass Counties. Goose River at Hillsboro affecting Traill County. Forest River at Minto affecting Walsh County. Pembina River at Neche affecting Pembina County. .Additional rises due to rainfall tonight. Additional rainfall tonight and into Friday morning is expected to be scattered and light. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Forest River at Minto. * WHEN...From late Friday night to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. Left bank flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 4.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning to a crest of 6.7 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
